page.title: 06The Deeside Railway Line
page.content: The old Deeside Railway line is situated to the South of Cults.It ran only as far as Ballater because when it was built Queen Victoria didn't want it running past Ballmoral Castle. The journey to Ballater was a very scenic route,and was popular with tourists but in the 1960's the whole track was lifted,and the line closed. It has not been completely put to waste now because people use it to have an easy stroll,jog,walk or a leisurly cycle.It passes many fields and also runs very near the River Dee at times.When it was closed down the old stations were sold.Some people redecorated them and stayed in them but others were just kept as store houses. Some of it is getting over grown and the line will probably get shorter in time.
